arm_group.description: To observe prognosis of resection of icc
To observe the prognosis of radiotherapy treatment of icc

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to confirm that prognosis of Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
      (ICC) with resection and radiotherapy ,to find which is safe and effective treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognosis of Resection and Radiotherapy in the Treatment of Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma (ICC), the second most common primary liver cancer and
      constitutes 10% of primary liver malignancies.

      Current therapies for the treatment of ICC are ineffective and the role of liver
      transplantation is not well defined.

      This study reviews our experience with this tumor and looks for preoperative and pathologic
      indices that may help determine long term prognosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female patients > 17 years and <=60 years of age. confirmed case (patients
             with ICC) Tumors can be radical removed and resection volume was ≤50%. Criteria of
             liver function: Child A level, serum bilirubin ≤ 1.5 times the upper limit of normal
             value,alanine aminotransferase and aspartate aminotransferase ≤ 2 times the upper
             limit of normal value.

        No dysfunction in major organs; Blood routine, kidney function, cardiac function and lung
        function are basically normal. Hbg ≥ 90g/L, WBC ≥ 3.000 cells/mm³,platelets ≥ 80.000
        cells/mm³.

        Karnofsky Performance Score performance over 60. Patients who can understand this trial
        and have signed information consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who have undergone previous treatment by Resection or Radiotherapy. Patients
             with apparent cardiac, pulmonary, cerebronic and renal dysfunction, which may affect
             the treatment of liver cancer.

        Patients with other diseases which may affect the treatment mentioned here. Patients with
        medical history of other malignant tumors. Subjects participating in other clinical
        trials. Extrahepatic metastasis, portal vein or other major vascular involvement. liver
        function: Child B C.

        Patients would not sign the consent to the trial.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Resection and Radiotherapy in the Prognosis of Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma Patients

overall_official.affiliation: Eastern Hepatobiliary Surgery Hospital, Second Military Medical University

primary_outcome.measure: the overall survival rate of each group
